p: The difference in the leaf N content among plant species was significant (F 8,199 = 21.036, P < 0.001), and the leaf N content of A. philoxeroides was the highest among all of the evaluated species ( Fig. 3b). The leaf C/N ratio also differed significantly among plant species (F 8,199 = 18.046, P < 0.001); the leaf C/N ratio of A. philoxeroides was the lowest of all of the species ( Fig. 3c). Mean defoliation value was positively correlated with the mean leaf N content ( Fig. 4a, P = 0.035) but negatively correlated with the mean leaf C/N ratio ( Fig. 4b, P = 0.08).
